item.title: Omg help please!
item.dc:creator: @Jordiescape Jordiescape
item.description:
@Jordiescape wrote:

[quote=“Mrs Extro Limited, post:3, topic:240984”][quote author=Jordiescape link=topic=317301.msg2517894#msg2517894 date=1225735046]
Add it in your global objects method.
[/quote]
What you talking about?
It’s a command so this is what you do.

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("block") && (playerRights >= 1)) { makeGlobalObject(absX, absY, 6177, -2, 10); } else { sendMessage("You wish you could make blocks bitch!"); }

There you go.[/quote]
What are you talking about? He said it vanishes when people log out, so I’m presuming he wants it permanent, so stfu =]

item.title: Omg help please!
item.dc:creator: @paulpkyou paulpkyou
item.description:
@paulpkyou wrote:

Hello, i made a command ::block where it makes a box but when people log off it disaperes, i want to make it so if people log off then on it will still be there, any ideas? thanks - Paulpkyou

P.s. heres my code:

Also i am a noob at coding so please suply me with a complete code

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("block") && (playerRights >= 1)) { makeGlobalObject(absX, absY, 6177, -2, 10); } else if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("block") && (playerRights >= 0)) { sendMessage("You wish you could make blocks bitch!"); }

Read full topic
